Ghanaian Man Who Married Two Women Same Day Says Tinubu Signs N28.7trillion 2024 Budget Into Law New Year: Tinubu Promises New Minimum Wage For Workers Posted by Thandiubani on Mon 01st Jan, 2024 - tori.ng Tinubu disclosed this in his New Year broadcast to Nigerians on Monday. Nigeria's President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has promised a new minimum wage for workers. He made the declaration in his New Year message to Nigerians. He promised that his administration will implement a new minimum wage for Nigerian workers in 2024. Tinubu disclosed this in his New Year broadcast to Nigerians on Monday. According to him, the economic challenges Nigerians are facing occasioned by fuel subsidy removal and exchange rate reforms will soon be a time of the past. He assured that his government is committed to ensuring the security of all Nigerians. “Every decision, every trip outside the shore of our land has been undertaken since my assumption of office on May 29th 2023 has been made in the country’s best interest. “I will fight every obstacle that hinders business in Nigeria.” “We will implement a new national minimum for Nigerian workers in this new year,” he said. facebook twitter google+ linkedin email Top Stories Mercy Aigbe Celebrates 46th Birthday With Stunning Photos Bola Tinubu Sends New Year Message to Nigerians [FULL SPEECH] Veteran Nigerian Actor, Zack Orji In ‘Critical Condition' Rushed To Abuja Hospital After 'Slumping In Toilet' (Video) Stop Downplaying Women’s Achievements Because Of Marriage – BBNaija’s Uriel Warns 2024: President Tinubu To Address Nigerians On New Year Day Popular Stories Being Young Is Not An Advantage: See List Of Young NIgerians Who Have Held Powerful Positions Check Out Wierd Traditions Across Africa (Photos) 5 Nigerians That Have Been Nominated For Grammy Awards Lady Who Spent 23-years Growing Her Nails Crowned the Woman with Longest Fingernails (Photos) Incredible!
